support_subtitle: We're here to help you with any questions or issues
official_gst_helpdesk: Official GST helpdesk for government compliance queries
gstn_support: GSTN (Goods and Services Tax Network) support
gst_registration_question: What is GST and who needs to register?
gst_registration_answer: GST (Goods and Services Tax) is a unified tax system in India. You need to register if your turnover exceeds ‚Çπ40 lakhs (or ‚Çπ20 lakhs for specific states) or if you are involved in inter-state supplies.
gst_deadlines_question: What are the GST filing deadlines?
gst_deadlines_answer: Monthly returns (GSTR-1, GSTR-2) are due by the 10th of the following month. Quarterly returns are due by the 13th of the following month. Annual returns (GSTR-9) are due by 31st December.
gst_calculation_question: How do I calculate GST on my bills?
gst_calculation_answer: GST is calculated as: GST Amount = Base Price √ó GST Rate (5%, 12%, 18%, or 28%). Total Amount = Base Price + GST Amount
gst_documents_question: What documents are needed for GST registration?
gst_documents_answer: You need: PAN Card, AADHAAR card, Business address proof, Previous 3 months bank statements, IT returns (if applicable).
gst_difference_question: What is the difference between GSTR-1 and GSTR-2?
gst_difference_answer: GSTR-1: Contains details of all outward supplies (sales). GSTR-2: Contains details of all inward supplies (purchases). Both are filed monthly.
itc_question: Can I get ITC (Input Tax Credit)?
itc_answer: Yes, you can claim ITC on the GST paid on inputs if they are used for taxable supplies. ITC must be claimed within the prescribed periods.
gstr9_answer: GSTR-9 is the annual return consolidating all monthly transactions. It must be filed by 31st December of the following financial year.
appeal_question: How do I appeal if there is a GST demand?
appeal_answer: You can appeal to the GST Appellate Authority. First, request the Full Authority for Advance Ruling (AAR) if clarification is needed, or directly file an appeal.
important_notice_text: This app is designed to assist with GST compliance. Always verify information with official GST portals (www.gst.gov.in) and consult with tax professionals for critical decisions. The helpdesk numbers provided are official government numbers. Contact them for official guidance.
tip_itc_desc: Claim ITC on business purchases to reduce GST liability. Keep invoices organized!
tip_voice_desc: Try voice-based bill entry! Just speak invoice details and AI will fill the form.
tip_comply_desc: File GSTR-1 by 11th and GSTR-3B by 20th of every month to avoid penalties.
tip_analytics_desc: Check monthly reports to understand your tax trends and plan better.
